author: .fjl
content: wait, what is the `wallet_` namespace about?

author: sky.cactus
content: The idea is to create a new JSON-RPC method namespace that is for calls that Ethereum clients wouldn't implement, but wallets would.  `wallet_signTransaction`, `wallet_sendTransaction`, etc. would go there.

author: sky.cactus
content: And we would deprecate `eth_signTransaction` and `eth_sendTransaction` and other methods that are meant for wallets (the thing that holds user private keys and can sign stuff with them).

author: .fjl
content: We've had that goal for a long time, but it turned out very difficult

author: .fjl
content: `eth_fillTransaction` was introduced for that reason, to perform all the defaults-setting steps the node can do while not actually signing

author: .fjl
content: It's supposed to be an off-ramp for users of `eth_sendTransaction`

author: .fjl
content: We later kind of gave up and added external signer support in geth, because people didn't stop using sendTransaction but we didn't want the keys in the node anymore

author: sky.cactus
content: The biggest challenge is that wallets are very uncoordinated compared to client dev teams.  However, that isn't a good reason to continue to have the clients implement JSON-RPC methods that are really only for wallets.

author: .fjl
content: How about an official spec from us with tests and all?

author: .fjl
content: Judging by the last couple years of progress, we are actually getting way better at this coordination/spec process for the RPC API
